alert.note: Alert for Logan; Simpson; Warren (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 2:31PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Logan, Simpson and southwestern Warren Counties through 200 PM CDT... At 131 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Russellville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Warren, central Logan and Simpson Counties, including the following locations... Black Jack, Dennis, Rich Pond, Geddes, Cave Springs, Middleton, Peden Mill, Hillsdale, Danby and Neosheo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
